authors.name: Jill V Hagey
authors.affiliation: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

authors.name: Technical  Outreach and Assistance for States Team
authors.affiliation: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"t0om","text":"The Titan_Illumina_PE workflow is a part of the Public Health Viral Genomics Titan series for SARS-CoV-2 genomic characterization. Titan_Illumina_PE  was written specifically to process Illumina paired-end (PE) read data. Input reads are assumed to be the product of sequencing tiled PCR-amplicons designed for the SARS-CoV-2 genome. The most common read data analyzed by the Titan_Illumina_PE workflow are generated with the ARTIC V3 protocol. However, alternative primer schemes such as the QIAseq Primer Panel are also suitable for this workflow. The primer sequence coordinates of the PCR scheme utilized must be provided in BED format along with the raw Illumina read data. Upon initiating a Titan_Illumina_PE job, the input primer scheme coordinates and raw paired-end Illumina read data provided for each sample will be processed to perform consensus genome assembly, infer the quality of both raw read data and the generated consensus genome, and assign lineage or clade designations as outlined in the Titan_Illumina_PE data workflow diagram below.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6s5te","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b52dt","text":"Additional technical documentation for the Titan_Illumina_PE workflow is available at:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e1npc","text":"https://public-health-viral-genomics-theiagen.readthedocs.io/en/latest/titan_workflows.html#titan-workflows-for-genomic-characterization","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":136}],"data":[]},{"key":"6krtb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6pbu5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a93k7","text":" PE:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":38},{"style":"bold","offset":39,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cro89","text":"Illumina paired-end read data (forward and reverse FASTQ files per sample)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5n6ck","text":"Primer sequence coordinates of the PCR scheme utilized in BED file format","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f9ljn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"de83o","text":"Video fork_info.title: Titan Illumina PE SARS-CoV-2 Strain Characterization Workflow for the Terra Platform

creator.name: Technical Outreach and Assistance for States Team
creator.affiliation: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

forks.title: Running the TheiaCoV_Illumina_PE Workflow on Terra.bio

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"q92v","text":"To run the Titan workflow, click on the 'Workflows' panel in the newly created workspace. It should bring you to the following page. if you do not see the Titan_Illumina_PE workflow in your workspace, please see our video on importing a workflow to Terra.bio: https://youtu.be/ZRpQylIDMzo).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":260,"length":28}],"data":{}},{"key":"ch9p6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"lgon","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fku2r","text":"Click on the 'Titan_Illumina_PE' tile and it will take you to a new page (if you do not see the Titan_ClearLabs workflow in your workspace, please see our video on importing a workflow to Terra.bio: https://youtu.be/ZRpQylIDMzo). Double check that you are using the latest version of the workflow. Alternately, you may specify another version, but should only pick a stable version (with numbers) NOT a 'main' or 'dev' version. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":230,"length":68},{"style":"bold","offset":343,"length":85}],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":199,"length":28}],"data":{}},{"key":"fhece","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2k6tg","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9hkr4","text":"Click the 'Run workflow(s) with inputs defined by data table' option button and then in the 'Select root entity type' pull-down menu, select 'sample' or whichever entity type you specified in the sample table. The first four rows in the 'Inputs' tab should each have a yellow caution icon. These four rows represent variables that have to be provided by the user. This is the information that we populated the sample data table with in the previous steps. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":290,"length":73}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1ecb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cfan1","text":"Make sure \"Use call caching\" is checked and then select the root entity type for the data you wish to analyze (here it's sample).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ogro","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dd774","text":"NOTE: Call caching allows Terra to identify and skip jobs that have been run previously; this option is by default enabled to  avoid unnecessary compute costs. More information on Terra call caching, including examples of when you may want to disable this feature, is available through the Terra Support Documentation. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":290,"length":27}],"data":{}},{"key":"efm9p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d5e2u","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":5,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"42frp","text":"For the first row, click on the 'Attribute' text box and then click 'workspace.Artic_V3_primers' (or whatever you named the primer bed file). In the second row we input our primer_bed file of choice, which should be saved as a workspace element in Terra (if you do not have this saved as a workspace element please see our video on uploading a workspace element: https://youtu.be/Qrbz7uRtwmQ).  For the next row, the 'read1_raw' variable, click on the 'Attribute' text box and then click 'this.rea1'. In the third row, the 'read2_raw' variable, click on the 'Attribute' text box and then click 'this.read2'. Finally, in the third row, the 'samplename' variable, click on the 'Attribute' text box and then click option that displays your root entity in the notiation: 'this.root_entity'. Click the 'Save' button on the top right-hand side of the page. The yellow caution icons should disappear.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":6,"offset":363,"length":28}],"data":{}},{"key":"7refq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9qvcf","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":7,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8vcb7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":8,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9d4am","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2dger","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5dgk2","text":"Next, click the \"output\" tab and select \"use defaults\" to autofill in the names of the output files according to the sample names. If you forget to select this option, you will have trouble accessing the results! Save changes by clicking the 'Save' button.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":213,"length":43}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"19oe9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7p8f9","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":9,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a0i8o","text":"You are now ready to run the Titan_Illumina_PE workflow! Click the blue 'select data' button and select the samples you want to run or click the check box at the very top left to select all of them to be run. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aajjc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bc0qg","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":10,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"60lmd","text":"Click on the 'Run Analysis' button to the right of the 'Outputs' tab. A popup window should appear titled 'Confirm launch'. If the 'Run Analysis' button is greyed out, you need to save your recent changes by clicking the 'Save' button.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":123,"length":112}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3htr9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ag564","text":"     ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":11,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6s15m","text":"Click the 'Launch' button to access the 'Job History' panel where each sample will be queued for the Titan_Illumina_PE analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"covbm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"el8sa","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":12,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"asn53","text":"The status will change from 'Queued' to 'Submitted' to 'Running.' After the workflow finishes, the status column will indicate either 'successful' or 'failed.' ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bmggi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"21c3r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5p7ja","text":"If you run into any trouble at all please feel free to check out our video on Running the Titan_Illumina_PE Workflow, or reach out to our support email: support@terrapublichealth.zendesk.com","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"3C16964C43FA11EC8AE50A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://youtu.be/ZRpQylIDMzo"}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"03E35680B1CB11EBA76E6F0107A4666E","height":200,"id":179666,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"94ll3","text":"The workflows panel in the newly created Terra workspace","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/frqwbi9m7.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/frqubi9m7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/frqvbi9m7.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/frqtbi9m7.webp","width":550}},"10":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"95B2A740B28511EB92A4C1F5AF5D3464","height":275,"id":179698,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"16jau","text":"Check the box to have all samples run through the Titan_Illumina_PE title: Running the Titan_Illumina_PE Workflow on Terra.bio
